alert.note: Alert for Cape May; Cumberland; Salem (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 3:40PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...ELEVATED RISK OF WILDFIRE SPREAD INTO EARLY THIS EVENING... Relative humidity values are around 20 percent this afternoon into early this evening in far southern New Jersey. The winds will be north-northwest 10 to 15 mph with gusts to around 25 mph. These weather conditions in combination with the recent stretch of dry weather will continue to result in an elevated risk for the spread of wildfires into early this evening. Use extra caution if handling any potential ignition source, such as machinery, or cigarettes and matches. Be sure to properly discard all smoking materials. Any dry grasses, dead leaves, or other tree litter that ignite will have the potential to spread fire quickly. For more information about wildfire danger, burn restrictions, and wildfire prevention and eduction, please visit your state forestry or environmental protection website.
